Basic details: Michael Green, a 22-year-old male, presents to the clinic with a persistent cough.
Vitals:
BP: 120/80 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 88/minute, regular
Physical presentation: Sit upright and occasionally cough into your hand. Show mild discomfort when taking deep breaths. If asked about sputum, mention it's occasionally greenish. If a chest X-ray is mentioned, ask, "What will that show?"
Challenging question: "Could this be something serious like pneumonia or just a common cold?"
